shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Daily Office Prayers and Litanies (fols. 1ra-23vb) II) Śǝrʿatä qǝddase “Ordinary of the Mass” (fols. 24ra-66vb) III) Anaphoras (fols. 66vb-183va) III-1) Anaphora of the Apostles (fols. 66vb-80vb) III-2) Anaphora of Our Lord Jesus Christ preceded by an excerpt from the "Book of the Testament" (fols. 81ra-85rb) III-3) Anaphora of Our Lady by St. Cyriacus of Behnesa (fols. 85va-97ra) III-4) Anaphora of St. John the Son of Thunder (fols. 97rb-107vb) III-5) Anaphora of the 318 Orthodox Fathers of Nicaea (fols. 108ra-117rb) III-6) Anaphora of St. Athanasius of Alexandria (fols. 117va-130rb) III-7) Anaphora of St. Basil of Caesarea (fols. 130va-141ra) III-8) Anaphora of St. Gregory of Nyssa (“Hosanna-liturgy of St. Gregory”) (fols. 141rb-148va) III-9) Anaphora of St. Epiphanius of Cyprus (fols. 148vb-156vb) III-10) Anaphora of St. John Chrysostom (fols. 157ra-163rb) III-11) Anaphora of St. Cyril of Alexandria (fols. 163rb-170va) III-12) Anaphora of St. Dioscorus of Alexandria (fols. 170va-173ra) III-13) Anaphora of St. Jacob of Serug (fols. 173ra-179vb) III-14) Second Anaphora of St. Gregory (“Christmas-liturgy of St. Gregory”) (fols. 179vb-183va)
Additiones 1-2.

dcomments.dcomment: Fols. 8vb, 9ra, 42vb, 47vb, etc.: Mǝnilǝk is mentioned as the reigning King, Qerǝllos as the Patriarch, Ṗeṭros as liqä ṗaṗas (Metropolitan?; name written in black ink and by a different hand) and Matewos as ṗaṗas (bishop). Mǝnilǝk II was Emperor of Ethiopia in 1889-1913, Cyril V was Patriarch of Alexandria in 1874-1927, Ṗeṭros IV was Metropolitan of Ethiopia in 1881-89 (demoted by Mǝnilǝk II who made him bishop of the northern territories including Tǝgray), Matewos was Metropolitan of Ethiopia in 1889-1926. The Ms. most probably dates to the initial years of Mǝnilǝk’s reign, as the data of the supplication formulas reflect the uncertainty concerning the status of the two Ethiopian prelates at this period.

txstates.txstate: Many leaves are worn out and stained with dirt, some portions of the text are difficult to read. The binding is damaged: the leather cover, endbands are to the most part torn off; original sewing is to the most part missing.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather (to the most part missing), textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations. Remains of two pairs of reinforcing stitches through the spine cover.

bnstatedetails.bnstatedetail: The leather cover, endbands are to the most part torn off; original sewing is to the most part missing.

squires.squire: I(12/s. l.: 5, 8, stubs after 4, 7/fols. 1r-12v) – II(10/fols. 13r-22v) – III(11/s. l.: 10, stub after 1/fols. 23r-33v) – IV(10/fols. 34r-43v) – V(10/fols. 44r-53v) – VI(13/s. l.: 12, stub after 1/fols. 54r-66v) – ፯VII(10/fols. 67r-76v) – VIII(10/fols. 77r-86v) – IX(12/fols. 87r-98v) – X(12/s. l.: 5, 8, stubs after 5, 8/fols. 99r-110v) – XI(12/fols. 111r-122v) – XII(12/fols. 123r-134v) – XIII(12/s. l.: 5, 8, stubs after 5, 8/fols. 135r-146v) – XIV(12/fols. 147r-158v) – ፲፭XV(12/fols. 159r-170v) – XVI(12/fols. 171r-182v) – XVII(4/fols. 183r-186v).

taunit.ln-info: average number; actual numbers vary from 18 to 21
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible (s. fol. 48r). Ruling pricks are visible (s. fol. 40r). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

txlines.txline: average number; actual numbers vary from 18 to 21

rulings.ruling: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible (s. fol. 48r). Ruling pricks are visible (s. fol. 40r). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra; names of the King, Patriarch and Metropolitan; name of the donor; headings and incipits of the texts; directives for the ministers; some of the musical notation signs above the lines; abbreviations; elements of the punctuation signs and Ethiopic numerals.
Text on fols. 1r, 24r, 32r, 81ra is written alternately in red and black lines. The incipits of most Anaphoras as well as indications concerning liturgical occasions on which the respective Anaphoras should be celebrated are written alternately in red and black letters (s. fols. 81vb, 85v, 97rb, 117va, etc.).

abbreviations.abbreviation: ይካ፡ for ይበል፡ ካህን፡ ይዲ፡ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡ ይሕ፡ for ይበል፡ ሕዝብ፡ ቡራ፡ for ቡራኬ፡ እማ፡ for እማሬ፡ በእ፡ for በእንተ፡

otherdetails.otherdetail: Some of the short introductory texts are written in a single column, s. fols. 1r, 85v. Text III-7 (Anaphora of St. Basil of Caesarea) is preceded by a short fragment to be recited during Mass celebrated by a bishop (fol. 130va).

additional.cont: Fol. 183va-vb: Donation note.
additional.tran: Fol. 183va: This is a book which Wälättä Gäbrǝˀel has donated to the [fol. 183vb] church of Maryam (in) Fäqada so that it may be for her a guide in the Kingdom of Heaven. He who steals it or erases (its text) shall be excommunicated by the authority of Peter and Paul.
additional.det: The letter ቃ in ወዘፈሐቃ፡ is written with a horizontal upper stroke characteristic of the letter for the spirantized ejective velar in Tǝgrǝñña.

additional.cont: Fol. 185v. Sǝfrä säˁatat "Measuring of the Hour".
additional.det: Note on computus; the table shows interrelation between parts of the day (listed in the rightmost column) and months of the year (listed in the upper row). Cp. Sǝfrä säʿat in Ms. AP-001.

extras.extra: - Corrections or additions to the text: fols. 3v, 11r, 13v, 56v, 80v, etc. (in the margins). - Crude notes: fols. 47r, 68v, 148v, 149r, 162v (in the upper margin). - Name of the donor, Wälättä Gäbrǝʾel, enclosed in a frame: fols. 85v, 117v, 141r, 170v, 173r (in the upper margin). - Poorly legible crude notes, partly in Amharic: fol. 184r.

drawing.details: Schematic representation of the Eucharistic bread and its distribution among the participants of the Liturgy. The portions are indicated by inscriptions in each cell. The inscription above the drawing reads: ዝማኅተም፡ ዘሥጋ፡ ኢየሱስ። “This stamp is that of the flesh of Jesus”.

frames.frame: - Fol. 1r: Wide black ornamental band with geometric and floral ornamentation motifs over cols. a-b, at the incipit of Text I. - Fol. 127r: Three crudely drawn red narrow ornamental frames in cols. a-b.
